body.p:
To His Excellency
Jas. F. Robinson
Governor of Kentucky

Your petitioners would respectfully respresent that Michael McHew Decd late of Bath County was fined before Wm J. Shroutt a J P for Bath County five dollars for a breach of the Peace under the following circumstances One Robt Goodpaster & Stewart the brotherinlaw of McHew was quarrelling and about to fight when McHew said something which was encouraging to his brotherinlaw in effect if Stewart wanted to fight to fight on as he had one friend by when Goodpaster & McHew immediately got into a fight on a rocky road McHew fell & it is not known wheath he fell from the force of a blow from Goodpaster or not but in the fall his head struck a rock which threw him into a state of como insensibility & he lived about 36 hours & died before McHew died the J. P. find him & also Goodpaster
McHew leaves 2 small children no widow & is a poor man we ask your excellency to remit the fine Jany 28th 1863
